messages: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:45): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Can you point out where in SVG Tiny the spec allows support of values not defined in SVG Tiny?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:45): is scanning through the document, isn't sure what to look for
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:47): well, I do understand you point, and maybe that's not a solution... we are still gathering information
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:48): http://dev.w3.org/SVG/profiles/1.2T/publish/implnote.html#UnsupportedProps seems to forbid it...
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:48): looking further
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:48): I want to make sure supporting "text-align: left" is allowed
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:49): sure, of course
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:49): we could add language to that effect
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:49): which would actually be good, IMO, so that vendors could experiment
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:49): well, I don't want "text-align: mySpecialFu" to be allowed :)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:50): but values defined in SVG Full / CSS should be allwoed
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:50): because that's non-standard
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:50): and should therefore *be* non-standard
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:50): lots of stuff is non-standard
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:50): implementation experience is a good way to inform standards
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): vendors can experiment, and should follow the naming conventions for experimentation
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): but that doesn't mean it should be valid SVG Tiny
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): or valid CSS
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:51): If SVG Tiny's point is to be a profile, it "text-align: left" might not even be valid SVG Tiny
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:52): but a UA should not be non-conforming if it does support that value
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:52): only the SVG document would be non-conforming in that case
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:52): do you have a suggestion?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:52): Say that SVG documents that include properties/values/attributes/whatever that are not defined in SVG Tiny are non-conforming
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:53): I'd be surprised if that's not in there somewhere

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:53): but UAs that support properties/values/attributes/whatever that are not defined in SVG Tiny but are defined in the relevant SVG / CSS specs are not non-conforming
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:54): feel free to paste my comments into that text-align issue, because that's what it's really about
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:54): http://dev.w3.org/SVG/profiles/1.2T/publish/conform.html#ConditionallyConformingSVGDocuments
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:55): okay, I'll bring that back to the SVG WG
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:56): tries to read your spec
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:58): it seems to be written as if it was the SVG spec, and not the SVG Tiny spec
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:58): I can't see anything defining conformance of a renderer to SVG Tiny
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (23:58): only to SVG
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:58): I'll have a look over that

227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (23:59): it would be nice if you were to articulate this larger issue in an email, because I have a feeling that this is an overarching problem that will resolve other issue systematically
